title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: This is very tiresome--not to be able to walk abroad for an instant,but to be kept in this old house which they call "The Fountain," amansion made of wood in imitation of a ship. The timbers were well triedlast night during the squall.

title: Sketches of Travel; or, Twelve Months in Europe
author: King, Horatio
snippet: The Fountain of Trevi is a wonderfully perfectrepresentation of Nature, heightened in interest byart. Its water, drawn "from a source far beyondthe walls," of the city, "sparkles forth as pure asthe virgin who first led Agrippa to its well springsby her father's door."

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter

title: Sketches of travel:
author: King, Horatio
snippet: The Fountain of Trevi is a wonderfully perfect representation of Nature, heightened in interest by art. Its water, drawn "from a source far beyond the walls," of the city, "sparkles forth as pure as the virgin who first led Agrippa to its well springs by her father's door."

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Saw a battle on the rampart between two sailor boys, who fought like game-cocks. Returned to " The Fountain," to a voluminous  breakfast. Captain Pigot calls, with little hope of sailing to-day.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: This is very tiresome — not to be able to walk abroad for an instant,  but to be kept in this old house which they call " The Fountain,"  a mansion made of wood in imitation of a ship. The timbers were well tried last night during the squall.

title: Rambles in Europe.
author: Miller, Daniel
snippet: Of modern date is the Neptune Fountain. The Fountain of the Virtues consists of female statues representing the virtues, surmounted  by a statue of Justice with a crane, the latter the symbol of vigilance. The "Gooseman^^ is a small fountain in the form of a man carrying a goose under each arm.
